title: Jeremy Vine: I thought as a teen that I just wasn't cut out to be a boy
text:
We asked the broadcaster, 54, what his younger self would make of his life

There was a moment at school, when I was about 14 or 15, when I was responsible for the entire rugby team losing. I will never forget the humiliation. I thought: “I’m just not cut out to be a boy.” In the Sixties and Seventies, you had to be sporty to be a boy, but if I tried going in for a tackle on the rugby pitch my legs would just give way. I was nervous, thoughtful, and quite sensitive.

I was a bit lost, in a way, but the radio was a massive thing for me as a child. I loved music, and music saved me from the isolation I felt when I was growing up. The person on the radio who I adored more than anyone else was Kenny...
description: We asked the broadcaster, 54, what his younger self would make of his life
